questiontext.text: A study of rush-hour traffic in Amsterdam shows the number of persons per vehicle entering a highway. Suppose X is the number of persons per vehicle with a mean of 1.5 and a standard deviation of 0.75 in the population.Ó A traffic expert estimates the capacity of an on-ramp to be 700 vehicles per hour. Use the Central Limit Theorem. Calculate an approximate the distribution of the average number of people in 700 randomly selected vehicles:

answer.text: The distribution has a mean of 1 and a standard deviation of 1.

feedback.text: The distribution has a mean of 1 and a standard deviation of 1.:Incorrect

answer.text: The distribution has a mean of 1.5 and a standard deviation of 0.028.

feedback.text: The distribution has a mean of 1.5 and a standard deviation of 0.028…: Correct

answer.text: The distribution has a mean of 1.5 and a standard deviation of 0.75

feedback.text: The distribution has a mean of 1.5 and a standard deviation of 0.75: Incorrect

answer.text: The distribution has a mean of 350 and a standard deviation of 700.

feedback.text: The distribution has a mean of 350 and a standard deviation of 700…: Incorrect
